members.name: activity_threshold
members.explanation:
Activity threshold (squelch).
   activity_threshold == 0   // Inactive.
   activity_threshold > 0    // Active, can perform most actions.
   activity_threshold == 255 // Active, can perform all actions.

At each monster update (20 times per sec) the activity threshold is set to
255 if the monster is within line of sight from the player. If the monster
is outside of line of sight, the threshold is decremented by 1 until it
reaches 0.

   activity_threshold -= 1  // Decrement when player is outside of line of sight.
   activity_threshold = 255 // Set when player is within line of sight.

DPiece.explanation:
A DPiece represents a dungeon piece, which specifies how to arrange frames of
a level CEL file in order to form a miniature tile. A dungeon piece consists
of 10 or 16 blocks, where each non-empty block is represented by a CEL frame.
A block specifies the graphics of a single block in a dungeon piece.
Frame number in the level CEL file; or 0 if empty;
   block&0x0FFF.
Frame type, specifying the CEL decoding algorithm of the frame;
   (block&0x7000) >> 12

members.name: blocks
members.explanation: Either 10 or 16 blocks constituting the dungeon piece.

applied if item description becomes too long after adding affixes

Rarely set, only for undead crown and even this

members.name: excluded_combination
members.explanation:
contains 0x01 or 0x10. If (suffix | preffix) == 0x11 they will
never be applied to a single item simultaneously. Also if prefix
has value 0x01 it also means that it can not be present on a staff
with a spell.

members.name: double_chance
members.explanation:
if it is set then there's a twice is likely chance that this affix
will be generated than if it's not

members.name: not_cursed
members.explanation:
cursed affixes are never applied to items sold in town and also have
lower probability to be applied in other cases.

items_get_rand_loot_id_from_monster.explanation:
items_get_rand_loot_id_from_monster returns the loot ID of a random item
drop from the monster.
The loot ID is positive for regular items and negative for unique items, as
further described by the following pseudo-code.
   switch {
   case loot_id > 0:
      // regular item drop.
      item_id = loot_id - 1
   case loot_id < 0:
      // unique item drop.
      unique_item_id = -loot_id - 1
   case loot_id == 0:
      // no item drop.
   }
The drops are calculated as follows.
   * Winged Fiends (i.e. Fiend, Blink, Gloom and Familiar) never drop items.
   * The Butcher always drops The Butcher's Cleaver.
   * Skeleton King always drops The Undead Crown.
   1) rnd(100) > 40: no drop
   2) rnd(100) > 25: drop gold
   3) Drop a random item with qlvl <= mlvl
      - The drop rate of an item determines if it has non-existant, regular
        or double chance of dropping.
      - In single player, items with the Resurrect or the Heal Other spell
        never drop.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#item_id
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#unique_item_id

direction.explanation:
Directions.
# Map layout
                 (x=0 y=0)
                     _
                    / \
                   /   \
              y   /     \   x
                 /       \
                /         \
   (x=0 y=95)  |           |  (x=95 y=0)
                \         /
                 \       /
                  \     /
                   \   /
                    \_/
                (x=95 y=95)
# Step based on direction
   * South      (x+1, y+1)
   * South west (x,   y+1)
   * West       (x-1, y+1)
   * North west (x-1, y)
   * North      (x-1, y-1)
   * North east (x,   y-1)
   * East       (x+1, y-1)
   * South east (x+1, y)

towner_id.explanation: Towner IDs for NPCs in Tristram.

unique_monster_id.explanation: Unique monster IDs specify unique_monster_data array indices.

nblocks.explanation:
10 blocks for l1.min, l2.min and l3.min
16 blocks for l4.min and town.min

save_ptr.explanation:
save_ptr holds a pointer into the contents of the save file, used for loading
saves.

sha1_contexts.explanation:
sha1_contexts specifies the global SHA-1 contexts, which are used to
generate the codec key for save file encoding and decoding.

quest_cel.explanation: quest_cel points to the contents of "data/quest.cel".

quests.explanation: quests contains the quests of the current game.

monster_total_kills_from_monster_id.explanation:
monster_total_kills_from_monster_id tracks the total number of monsters
killed per monster_id.

active_monster_nums.explanation: active_monster_nums keeps track of the monster_num of active monsters.

nmonster_types.explanation: nmonster_types specifies the number of active monster types.

error_buf.explanation: error_buf is a temporary buffer for formatted error messages.

terminating.explanation:
terminating specifies whether the game is terminating after a fatal
application error.

cleanup_thread_id.explanation: cleanup_thread_id stores the thread id of the last callee to appfat_cleanup.

empty_string.explanation: empty_string is a NULL-terminated empty string.

tmsg_queue.explanation: tmsg_queue is a queue of timed messages.

file_info.explanation: file_info contains information about the game executable and asset archives.

window_activated.explanation: window_activated indicates whether the window is being activated.

diablo_exe_path.explanation: diablo_exe_path specifies the path to diablo.exe.

unused_mpq.explanation: unused_mpq is a handle to an unused MPQ archive.

patch_rt_mpq_path.explanation: patch_rt_mpq_path specifies the path to patch_rt.mpq.

fnWindow_proc.explanation:
fnWindow_proc points to a user-defined function which processes messages sent
to the window.

diabdat_mpq.explanation: diabdat_mpq is a handle to the diabdat.mpq archive.

diabdat_mpq_path.explanation: diabdat_mpq_path specifies the path to diabdat.mpq.

patch_rt_mpq.explanation: patch_rt_mpq is a handle to the patch_rt.mpq archive.

killed_mom_parent.explanation:
killed_mom_parent specifies whether a process with the "MOM Parent" class has
been identified and killed.

screensaver_enabled_prev.explanation: screensaver_enabled_prev stores the previous state of the screensaver.

game_pass.explanation: game_pass specifies the password of the network game.

heroes.explanation:
heroes specifies the essential information about a player, as used in save
files.

max_players.explanation:
max_players specifies the maximum number of players in a game, where 1
represents a single player game and 4 represents a multi player game.

game_name.explanation: game_name specifies the name of the network game.

items.explanation: items contains the items on ground of the current game.

visions.explanation: visions contains the visions of the current game.

lightings.explanation: lightings contains the light sources of the current game.

lighting_disabled.explanation: lighting_disabled specifies whether light effects are disabled.

lighting_max.explanation: lighting_max specifies the maximum number of light effects.

DDP.explanation: DDP represents the DirectDraw palette of the system.

screen_buf.explanation: screen_buf is the display buffer, containing the pixels of the screen.

initial_seed.explanation: initial_seed represents the initial global seed of the game.

seed.explanation: seed represents the global seed of the game.

seed_count.explanation: seed_count specifies the number of invokations to engine_rand.

logical_palette.explanation:
logical_palette is an in-memory palette to which gamma corrections are
applied.

system_palette.explanation: system_palette is the active palette of the system.

orig_palette.explanation: orig_palette is the original palette as loaded from file.

nsystem_reserve_palette_entries.explanation:
nsystem_reserve_palette_entries specifies the number of reserved palette
entries.

square_cel.explanation: square_cel points to the contents of "data/quest.cel".

debug_active_monster_map.explanation: debug_active_monster_map tracks the active monsters on each dlvl of the map.

debug_dflag_map.explanation: debug_dflag_map tracks the dungeon flag DFLAG_08 on each dlvl of the map.

DSBs.explanation: DSBs contains the audio channels used for playback of sounds.

DS.explanation: DS is the sound system used for audio playback.

DS_inited.explanation: DS_inited specifies whether the sound system has been initialized.

music_volume.explanation: music_volume specifies the music volume in range [-1600, 0].

sound_volume.explanation: sound_volume specifies the sound volume in range [-1600, 0].

hDsound_dll.explanation: hDsound_dll provides a handle to the dynamic library dsound.dll.

music_track.explanation: music_track specifies the current music track playing.

DSB.explanation: DSB is a audio channel used for playback of sounds.

hWndParent.explanation: hWndParent is the window handle of the game.

mouse_y.explanation: mouse_y specifies the current Y-coordinate of the mouse cursor.

mouse_x.explanation: mouse_x specifies the current X-coordinate of the mouse cursor.

visible_tile_squares.explanation:
visible_tile_squares specifies whether tile squares are visible. In the
debug release of Diablo 1, this setting was configurable through the command
line flag "-v".
References:
   * http://diablo1.se/notes/debug.html

lighting_flag4.explanation: lighting_flag4 specifies flags used for light effects.

flag_r_seed.explanation:
flag_r_seed specifies the seed used for dungeon generation through the -r
command line flag.

level_frame_types.explanation:
level_frame_types specifies the CEL frame decoder type for each frame of the
level CEL (e.g. "levels/l1data/l1.cel").
The decoder type may be one of the following.
    0x0000 // cel.decodeType0
    0x1000 // cel.decodeType1
    0x2000 // cel.decodeType2
    0x3000 // cel.decodeType3
    0x4000 // cel.decodeType4
    0x5000 // cel.decodeType5
    0x6000 // cel.decodeType6
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/formats/tree/master/image/cel

npc_num_map.explanation:
npc_num_map contains the NPC numbers of the map. The NPC number represents a
towner number (towners array index) in Tristram and a monster number
(monsters array index) in the dungeon.
TODO: Figure out how to fix broken links. Requires graphics files, which may
not be put online. Perhaps, add a script to view locally.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/towners.cpp#towners
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/monsters.cpp#monsters

tile_id_map.explanation:
tile_id_map contains the tile IDs of the map.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/graphics/blob/master/l1/tiles/README.md#tileset-of-dungeon-layout-1

object_num_map.explanation:
object_num_map contains the object numbers (objects array indices) of the
map.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/objects.cpp#objects

nlevel_frames.explanation:
nlevel_frames specifies the number of frames in the level cel (e.g.
"levels/l1data/l1.cel").

tile_id_map_backup.explanation: tile_id_map_backup contains a backup of the tile IDs of the map.

dead_map.explanation:
dead_map contains the dead numbers (deads array indices) and dead direction
of the map, encoded as specified by the pseudo-code below.
   dead_num  = dead_map[x][y]&0x1F
   direction = dead_map[x][y]>>5
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/dead.cpp#deads
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#direction

dpiece_defs_map_1.explanation:
dpiece_defs_map_1 specifies the dungeon piece information for a given
coordinate and block number.

transparency_index.explanation: transparency_index specifies the current transparency category.

piece_id_map.explanation: piece_id_map contains the piece IDs of each tile on the map.

tile_defs.explanation:
tile_defs specifies the tile definitions of the active dungeon type; (e.g.
levels/l1data/l1.til).

dpiece_defs.explanation:
dpiece_defs specifies the dungeon piece definitions (a.k.a. miniture tiles)
of the active dungeon type; (e.g. levels/l1data/l1.min).

transparency_map.explanation: transparency_map specifies the transparency at each coordinate of the map.

dtype.explanation:
dtype specifies the active dungeon type of the current game.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#dungeon_type

dlvl.explanation: dlvl specifies the active dungeon level of the current game.

transparency_active.explanation: transparency_active specifies the active transparency indices.

level_frame_count.explanation:
level_frame_count specifies the CEL frame occurrence for each frame of the
level CEL (e.g. "levels/l1data/l1.cel").

level_cel.explanation:
level_cel points to the contents of the active tileset, which is one of
"levels/towndata/town.cel", "levels/l1data/l1.cel", "levels/l2data/l2.cel",
"levels/l3data/l3.cel" or "levels/l4data/l4.cel".

speed_cel_frame_num_from_light_index_fra.explanation:
speed_cel_frame_num_from_light_index_frame_num returns the frame number of
the speed CEL, an in memory decoding of level CEL frames, based on original
frame number and light index.
Note, given light index 0, the original frame number is returned.

player_num_map.explanation:
player_num_map contains the player numbers (players array indices) of the
map.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/player.cpp#players

arch_num_map.explanation:
arch_num_map contains the arch frame numbers of the map from the special
tileset (e.g. "levels/l1data/l1s.cel"). Note, the special tileset of
Tristram (i.e. "levels/towndata/towns.cel") contains trees rather than
arches.

level_special_cel.explanation:
level_special_cel points to the contents of the active special tileset, which
is one of "levels/towndata/towns.cel", "levels/l1data/l1s.cel" or
"levels/l2data/l2s.cel".

item_num_map.explanation:
item_num_map contains the item numbers (items array indices) of the map.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/items.cpp#items

quest_lvl.explanation:
quest_lvl specifies the active quest level of the current game.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#quest_level

level_frame_sizes.explanation:
level_frame_sizes specifies the size of each frame of the level cel (e.g.
"levels/l1data/l1.cel"). Indexed by frame numbers starting at 1.

set_height.explanation: set_height specifies the height of the active miniset of the map.

set_width.explanation: set_width specifies the width of the active miniset of the map.

set_xx.explanation: set_xx specifies the active miniset x-coordinate of the map.

lvl_view_y.explanation: lvl_view_y specifies the level viewpoint y-coordinate of the map.

lvl_view_x.explanation: lvl_view_x specifies the level viewpoint x-coordinate of the map.

view_x.explanation: view_x specifies the player viewpoint x-coordinate of the map.

view_y.explanation: view_y specifies the player viewpoint y-coordinate of the map.

set_yy.explanation: set_yy specifies the active miniset y-coordinate of the map.

missile_num_map.explanation:
missile_num_map contains the missile numbers (missiles array indices) of the
map.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/bss/missiles.cpp#missiles

dpiece_defs_map_2.explanation:
dpiece_defs_map_2 specifies the dungeon piece information for a given
coordinate and block number.

object_graphic_id_from_object_cel_num.explanation:
object_graphic_id_from_object_cel_num maps from object_cel_num to
object_graphic_id.

nobjects.explanation: nobjects specifies the number of active objects.

inventory_open.explanation: inventory_open specifies whether the inventory is open.

inv_cel.explanation:
inv_cel points to the contents of "data/inv/inv.cel", "data/inv/inv_rog.cel"
or "data/inv/inv_sor.cel".

update_belt.explanation: update_belt specifies whether the belt should be re-rendered.

warps.explanation: warps holds the opened entrance which connects two levels of the map.

ndialogue_lines.explanation:
ndialogue_lines specifies the number of lines in the active store owner
dialogue.

wirt_item.explanation: wirt_item contains the item for sale by Wirt.

griswold_premium_items.explanation: griswold_premium_items contains the premium items for sale by Griswold.

player_items.explanation:
player_items contains copies of player items for use by store owners in
dialogues.

adria_items.explanation: adria_items contains the items for sale by Adria.

ngriswold_premium_items.explanation:
ngriswold_premium_items specifies the number of premium items sold by
Griswold.

pepin_items.explanation: pepin_items contains the items for sale by Pepin.

item_base_gold.explanation: item_base_gold represents the base gold item.

griswold_basic_items.explanation: griswold_basic_items contains the basic items for sale by Griswold.

cut_scene_cel.explanation:
cut_scene_cel points to the contents of the active cut scene CEL
"gendata/cut*.cel".

hero_names.explanation:
hero_names contains a list of character names for the character selection
screen.

valid_save.explanation: valid_save specifies whether the save file is valid.

save_prev_tc.explanation: save_prev_tc stores the tick count of the previous hero save.

duricons_cel.explanation: duricons_cel points to the contents of "items/duricons.cel".

charbut_cel.explanation: charbut_cel points to the contents of "data/charbut.cel".

p8but2_cel.explanation: p8but2_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/p8but2.cel".

panel8bu_cel.explanation: panel8bu_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/panel8bu.cel".

char_cel.explanation: char_cel points to the contents of "data/char.cel".

smaltext_cel.explanation: smaltext_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/smaltext.cel".

talkbutt_cel.explanation: talkbutt_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/talkbutt.cel".

golddrop_cel.explanation: golddrop_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/golddrop.cel".

spellbkb_cel.explanation: spellbkb_cel points to the contents of "data/spellbkb.cel".

spelli2_cel.explanation: spelli2_cel points to the contents of "data/spelli2.cel".

spellbk_cel.explanation: spellbk_cel points to the contents of "data/spellbk.cel".

cel_ptr.explanation:
cel_ptr temporarily points to the contents of "ctrlpan/panel8.cel" and
"ctrlpan/p8bulbs.cel".

spelicon_cel.explanation: spelicon_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/spelicon.cel".

talkpanl_cel.explanation: talkpanl_cel points to the contents of "ctrlpan/talkpanl.cel".

movie_playing.explanation: movie_playing specifies whether a movie is currently playing.

loop_movie.explanation: loop_movie specifies whether to loop the playback of the movie.

delta_levels.explanation:
delta_levels contains delta information about items, objects and monsters for
each dungeon level to be synchronized with connected peers.

portals.explanation: portals contains the town portals of the current game.

has_greeted.explanation: has_greeted specifies whether an NPC has recently greeted the player.

cow_active_sfx_index.explanation:
cow_active_sfx_index specifies the active index (between 0 and 2) into
cow_sfx_id_from_class.

ntowners.explanation: ntowners specifies the number of active NPCs in Tristram.

ncow_clicks.explanation:
ncow_clicks specifies the number of consequtive times the player has
interacted with a cow.

has_initialized_wirt.explanation: has_initialized_wirt specifies whether Wirt has been initialized.

cow_cel.explanation: cow_cel points to the contents of "towners/animals/cow.cel".

dungeon_message_ticks.explanation:
dungeon_message_ticks specifies the number of game ticks to player the
dungeon message sound.

dungeon_message_sfx_id.explanation: dungeon_message_sfx_id specifies a dungeon message sound to play.

sfx_stream.explanation: sfx_stream is a handle to the current sound effect playing.

sfx_data_cur.explanation:
sfx_data_cur specifies the sound file and the playback state of the current
sound effect.

light_table_index.explanation: light_table_index specifies the current light entry.

screen_y_times_768.explanation: screen_y_times_768 is a pre-computed table for y*768; 0, 768, 1536, ...

cursor_draw_width_prev.explanation:
cursor_draw_width_prev specifies the width of the cursor being rendered on
the previous frame.

cursor_draw_x.explanation: cursor_draw_x specifies the X-coordinate of the cursor being rendered.

cursor_draw_y.explanation: cursor_draw_y specifies the Y-coordinate of the cursor being rendered.

screen_buf_end.explanation: screen_buf_end point to the end of the screen buffer used for rendering.

cursor_draw_height.explanation: cursor_draw_height specifies the height of the cursor being rendered.

level_cel_block.explanation:
level_cel_block specifies the current MIN block of the level CEL file, as
used during rendering of the level tiles.
   frameNum  := block&0x0FFF
   frameType := block&0x7000 >> 12

cursor_draw_x_prev.explanation:
cursor_draw_x_prev specifies the X-coordinate of the cursor being rendered on
the previous frame.

cursor_draw_y_prev.explanation:
cursor_draw_y_prev specifies the Y-coordinate of the cursor being rendered on
the previous frame.

arch_draw_type.explanation: arch_draw_type specifies the type of arches to render.

DDS_desc.explanation: DDS_desc describes the surface being rendered.

cel_transparency_active.explanation:
cel_transparency_active specifies whether transparency is active for the
current CEL file being decoded.

level_piece_id.explanation:
level_piece_id specifies the current dungeon piece ID of the level, as used
during rendering of the level tiles.

cursor_draw_width.explanation: cursor_draw_width specifies the width of the cursor being rendered.

draw_player.explanation: draw_player specifies a function used to render player graphics.
draw_player.type: int (*)(int, int, int, int, int, void *, int, int, int, int) __attribute__((fastcall))

cursor_draw_back_buffer.explanation: cursor_draw_back_buffer is an in-memory surface for the cursor graphics.

draw_monster_num.explanation: draw_monster_num specifies the monster_num to render.

cursor_draw_height_prev.explanation:
cursor_draw_height_prev specifies the height of the cursor being rendered on
the previous frame.

dead_num_stone_curse.explanation:
dead_num_stone_curse specifies the dead number (deads array index) of the
stone cursed animation.

l1_tile_bit_map.explanation:
l1_tile_bit_map represents a tile ID map of twice the size, repeating each
tile of the original map in blocks of 4.

l1_flag_map.explanation: l1_flag_map contains flags used for dungeon generation of the Cathedral.

l1_single_player_quest_dun_loaded.explanation:
l1_single_player_quest_dun_loaded specifies whether a single player quest DUN
has been loaded.

l1_horiz_room1.explanation:
l1_horiz_room1 specifies whether to generate a horizontal room at position 1
in the Cathedral.

l1_horiz_room2.explanation:
l1_horiz_room2 specifies whether to generate a horizontal room at position 2
in the Cathedral.

l1_horiz_room3.explanation:
l1_horiz_room3 specifies whether to generate a horizontal room at position 3
in the Cathedral.

l1_vert_room1.explanation:
l1_vert_room1 specifies whether to generate a vertical room at position 1 in
the Cathedral.

l1_vert_room2.explanation:
l1_vert_room2 specifies whether to generate a vertical room at position 2 in
the Cathedral.

l1_vert_room3.explanation:
l1_vert_room3 specifies whether to generate a vertical room at position 3 in
the Cathedral.

l1_single_player_quest_dun.explanation:
l1_single_player_quest_dun contains the contents of the single player quest
DUN file.

path_nodes.explanation:
path_nodes records the nodes of the path constructed by the path finding
algorithm.

objcurs_cel.explanation: objcurs_cel points to the contents of "data/inv/objcurs.cel".

automap_type_from_tile_id.explanation: automap_type_from_tile_id maps from tile_id to automap type.

automap_enabled.explanation: automap_enabled specifies whether the automap is enabled.

automap_discovered.explanation: automap_discovered tracks the explored areas of the map.

automap_zoom_level.explanation: automap_zoom_level specifies the scale of the automap.

bigtgold_frame_from_font_index.explanation:
bigtgold_frame_from_font_index maps from font index to bigtgold.cel
frame number.

bigtgold_character_width_from_frame.explanation:
bigtgold_character_width_from_frame maps from bigtgold.cel frame number to
character width. Note, the character width may be distinct from the frame
width, which is 46 for every bigtgold.cel frame.

player_armors.explanation: player_armors maps from armor animation to letter used in graphic files.

player_weapons.explanation: player_weapons maps from weapon animation to letter used in graphic files.

player_classes.explanation: player_classes maps from player class to letter used in graphic files.

event_types.explanation:
event_types contains the set of supported event types supported by the
multiplayer event handler.

item_prefix_data.explanation: item_prefix_data contains the data related to each item prefix.

item_suffix_data.explanation: item_suffix_data contains the data related to each item suffix.

unique_item_data.explanation: unique_item_data contains the data related to each unique item ID.

text_color_from_player_num.explanation:
text_color_from_player_num maps from player_num to text colour, as used in
chat messages.

speech_data.explanation:
speech_data contains the data related to each speech ID.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#speech_id

rand_increment.explanation:
rand_increment specifies the increment used in the Borland C/C++ pseudo-
random number generator algorithm.
   seed = 0x15A4E35*seed + 1
Note, this global variable is unused.

rand_multiplier.explanation:
rand_multiplier specifies the multiplier used in the Borland C/C++ pseudo-
random number generator algorithm.
  seed = 0x15A4E35*seed + 1
Note, this global variable is unused.

progress_bar_colours.explanation:
progress_bar_colours specifies the colour used for the progress bar as an
index into the palette.

progress_bar_screen_pos.explanation:
progress_bar_screen_pos specifies the screen position of the top left corner
of the progress bar.

smaltext_frame_from_font_index.explanation:
smaltext_frame_from_font_index maps from font index to smaltext.cel frame
number.

smaltext_character_width_from_frame.explanation:
smaltext_character_width_from_frame maps from smaltext.cel frame number to
character width. Note, the character width may be distinct from the frame
width, which is 13 for every smaltext.cel frame.

screen_offset_from_nlines_and_line_nr.explanation:
screen_offset_from_nlines_and_line_nr maps from line count and line number
pairs to screen offsets within the description box. The mapping is as
follows:
   * one line
      * 1st line: 177x430
   * two lines
      * 1st line: 177x418
      * 2nd line: 177x442
   * three lines
      * 1st line: 177x412
      * 2nd line: 177x430
      * 3rd line: 177x448
   * four lines
      * 1st line: 177x408
      * 2nd line: 177x423
      * 3rd line: 177x437
      * 4th line: 177x452
   * five lines
      * 1st line: 177x406
      * 2nd line: 177x418
      * 3rd line: 177x430
      * 4th line: 177x442
      * 5th line: 177x453

font_index_from_ascii.explanation:
font_index_from_ascii maps ASCII character code to font index, as used by the
small, medium and large sized fonts; which corresponds to smaltext.cel,
medtexts.cel and bigtgold.cel respectively.

medtexts_frame_from_font_index.explanation:
medtexts_frame_from_font_index maps from font index to medtexts.cel frame
number.

medtexts_character_width_from_frame.explanation:
medtexts_character_width_from_frame maps from medtexts.cel frame number to
character width. Note, the character width may be distinct from the frame
width, which is 22 for every medtexts.cel frame.

cow_sfx_id_from_class.explanation:
cow_sfx_id_from_class maps from active cow sound effect index and player
class to sound effect ID for interacting with cows in Tristram.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/data/towners.cpp#cow_active_sfx_id
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#player_class

monster_action_sounds.explanation:
monster_action_sounds specifies the characters used in the file name of
monster action sound files (a=attack, h=hit, d=die, s=special attack).

l1_shadow.explanation:
l1_shadow contains shadows for 2x2 blocks of base tile IDs in the Cathedral.
TODO: Figure out how to fix broken link. Requires graphics files, which may
not be put online. Perhaps, add a script to view locally.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/graphics/blob/master/l1/shadow/README.md

l1_base.explanation:
l1_base maps tile IDs to their corresponding base tile ID.
TODO: Figure out how to fix broken links. Requires graphics files, which may
not be put online. Perhaps, add a script to view locally.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/graphics/blob/master/l1/tiles/README.md
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/graphics/blob/master/l1/tiles/base.md

l1_plain.explanation:
l1_plain maps tile IDs to their corresponding undecorated tile ID.
TODO: Figure out how to fix broken link. Requires graphics files, which may
not be put online. Perhaps, add a script to view locally.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/graphics/blob/master/l1/tiles/README.md

x_delta_from_step_direction.explanation:
x_delta_from_step_direction maps from step direction to X-coordinate movement
delta.

y_delta_from_step_direction.explanation:
y_delta_from_step_direction maps from step direction to Y-coordinate movement
delta.

objcurs_frame_width_from_frame.explanation:
objcurs_frame_width_from_frame maps from objcurs.cel frame number to frame
width.

objcurs_frame_height_from_frame.explanation:
objcurs_frame_height_from_frame maps from objcurs.cel frame number to frame
height.

portal_town_y_from_player_num.explanation:
portal_town_y_from_player_num maps from player number to Y-coordinate of the
town portal position in Tristram.

portal_town_x_from_player_num.explanation:
portal_town_x_from_player_num maps from player number to X-coordinate of the
town portal position in Tristram.

quest_data.explanation: quest_data contains the data related to each quest_id.

quest_entrance_cursor_x_delta.explanation:
quest_entrance_cursor_x_delta specifies a delta in X-coordinates from the
quest entrance for which the hover text of the cursor will be visible.

quest_entrance_cursor_y_delta.explanation:
quest_entrance_cursor_y_delta specifies a delta in Y-coordinates from the
quest entrance for which the hover text of the cursor will be visible.

quest_stairway_names.explanation:
quest_stairway_names specifies the names of quest levels for the hover text
of the cursor.

rand_quest_id_group_1.explanation:
rand_quest_id_group_1 is a quest group containing the three quests the
Butcher, Ogden's Sign and Gharbad the Weak, which ensures that exactly one of
these three quests appears in any single player game.

rand_quest_id_group_2.explanation:
rand_quest_id_group_2 is a quest group containing the three quests Halls of
the Blind, the Magic Rock and Valor, which ensures that exactly one of these
three quests appears in any single player game.

rand_quest_id_group_3.explanation:
rand_quest_id_group_3 is a quest group containing the three quests Black
Mushroom, Zhar the Mad and Anvil of Fury, which ensures that exactly one of
these three quests appears in any single player game.

rand_quest_id_group_4.explanation:
rand_quest_id_group_4 is a quest group containing the two quests Lachdanan
and Warlord of Blood, which ensures that exactly one of these two quests
appears in any single player game.

missile_graphic_data.explanation:
missile_graphic_data contains the data related to each missile graphic ID.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#missile_graphic_id

str_49E040.explanation: "Monster %d "%s" getting hit by monster: MType NULL"

x_delta_from_start_location_tristram.explanation:
x_delta_from_start_location_tristram specifies the X-coordinate delta from
the player start location in Tristram.

y_delta_from_start_location_tristram.explanation:
y_delta_from_start_location_tristram specifies the Y-coordinate delta from
the player start location in Tristram.

x_delta_from_player.explanation:
x_delta_from_player specifies the X-coordinate delta from a player, used for
instanced when casting resurrect.

y_delta_from_player.explanation:
y_delta_from_player specifies the Y-coordinate delta from a player, used for
instanced when casting resurrect.

action_frame_from_player_class.explanation:
action_frame_from_player_class specifies the frame of each animation for
which an action is triggered, for each player class.

start_str_from_player_class.explanation:
start_str_from_player_class maps from player_class to starting stat in
strength.

start_mag_from_player_class.explanation: start_mag_from_player_class maps from player_class to starting stat in magic.

start_dex_from_player_class.explanation:
start_dex_from_player_class maps from player_class to starting stat in
dexterity.

start_vit_from_player_class.explanation:
start_vit_from_player_class maps from player_class to starting stat in
vitality.

start_chance_to_block_bonus_from_player_.explanation:
start_chance_to_block_bonus_from_player_class specifies the chance to block
bonus of each player class.

player_class_names2.explanation: player_class_names2 specifies the name of each player class.

max_stat_from_player_class.explanation: max_stat_from_player_class maps from player_class to maximum stats.

exp_limit.explanation: exp_limit specifies the experience point limit of each level.

player_class_names.explanation: player_class_names specifies the name of each player class.

str_49F0B0.explanation: "Player '%s' killed Diablo and left the game!"

str_48EC3C.explanation:
"Helm of Sprits"
NOTE: "Sprits" is an assumed typo of "Spirits" [1].
   [1]: http://diablo.wikia.com/wiki/Helm_of_Spirits

item_data.explanation: item_data contains the data related to each item ID.

item_drop_id_from_item_graphic_id.explanation: item_drop_id_from_item_graphic_id maps from item_graphic_id to item_drop_id.

item_drop_name_from_item_drop_id.explanation:
item_drop_name_from_item_drop_id maps from item_drop_id to the name of the
item drop graphics.

nitem_drop_frames_from_item_drop_id.explanation:
nitem_drop_frames_from_item_drop_id maps from item_drop_id to the number of
frames used by the item drop animation.

item_drop_sfx_id_from_item_drop_id.explanation:
item_drop_sfx_id_from_item_drop_id maps from item_drop_id to the sound effect
of dropping the item on ground.

item_place_sfx_id_from_item_drop_id.explanation:
item_place_sfx_id_from_item_drop_id maps from item_drop_id to the sound
effect of playing the item in the inventory.

item_y.explanation:
item_y specifies the current Y-coordinate used for validation of items on
ground.

griswold_premium_item_quality_lvl_delta.explanation:
griswold_premium_item_quality_lvl_delta maps from Griswold premium item
number to a quality level delta as added to the base quality level.

missile_coord_delta.explanation:
missile_coord_delta specifies X- and Y-coordinate deltas from a missile
target coordinate.

delta_from_circle_radius.explanation:
delta_from_circle_radius maps from circle radius to the X- and Y-coordinate
deltas from the center of a circle.

delta_thread.explanation:

to connected peers.

gamma_correction.explanation: gamma_correction specifies the gamma correction level.

coluor_cycling_enabled.explanation: coluor_cycling_enabled specifies whether colour cycling is enabled.

palette_bright.explanation: palette_bright specifies whether the palette has max brightness.

music_enabled.explanation: music_enabled specifies whether background music is enabled.

sound_enabled.explanation: sound_enabled specifies whether sound effects are enabled.

flag_ds_noduplicates.explanation:
flag_ds_noduplicates specifies that no duplicate audio channel should be
used.

music_track_id.explanation: music_track_id specifies the active background music track id.

track_names.explanation: track_names maps from track ID to track name.

exclusive.explanation: exclusive specifies whether to give the game exclusive access to the screen.

player_friendly.explanation: player_friendly specifies whether players are in non-PvP mode.

net_msg_texts.explanation: net_msg_texts maps from net_msg_id to hotkey network message.

net_msg_hotkeys.explanation: net_msg_hotkeys maps from net_msg_id to hotkey name.

network_thread.explanation: network_thread is a handle to the network thread.

single_menu.explanation: single_menu contains the game menu items of the single player menu.

multi_menu.explanation: multi_menu contains the game menu items of the multi player menu.

options_menu.explanation: options_menu contains the game menu items of the options menu.

music_toggle_names.explanation: music_toggle_names specifies the menu names for music enabled and disabled.

sound_toggle_names.explanation: sound_toggle_names specifies the menu names for sound enabled and disabled.

colour_cycling_toggle_names.explanation:
colour_cycling_toggle_names specifies the menu names for colour cycling
enabled and disabled.

object_id_from_dun_object_id.explanation: object_id_from_dun_object_id maps from dun_object_id to object_id.

object_data.explanation: object_data contains the data related to each object ID.

object_cel_name_from_object_graphic_id.explanation:
object_cel_name_from_object_graphic_id maps from object_graphic_id to object
CEL name.

barrel_x_delta.explanation: barrel_x_delta specifies the X-coordinate delta between barrels.

barrel_y_delta.explanation: barrel_y_delta specifies the Y-coordinate delta between barrels.

shrine_name_from_shrine_id.explanation: shrine_name_from_shrine_id maps from shrine_id to shrine name.

dlvl_min_from_shrine_id.explanation:
dlvl_min_from_shrine_id specifies the minimum dungeon level on which each
shrine will appear.

dlvl_max_from_shrine_id.explanation:
dlvl_max_from_shrine_id specifies the maximum dungeon level on which each
shrine will appear.

shrine_game_type_from_shrine_id.explanation:
shrine_game_type_from_shrine_id specifies the game type for which each shrine
may appear.

book_name_from_book_id.explanation: book_name_from_book_id maps from book_id to book name.

narrator_book_from_player_class.explanation:
narrator_book_from_player_class specifies the speech IDs of each dungeon type
narrator book, for each player class.

inv_num_start_for_2x2.explanation:
inv_num_start_for_2x2 specifies the starting inventry number for placement of
2x2 items.

str_48EA14.explanation: "A duplicate item has been detected.  Destroying duplicate..."

str_48EA54.explanation: "A duplicate item has been detected from another player."

description_box_text_y_offset.explanation:
description_box_text_y_offset maps from line number to Y offset in pixels for
text drawn in the description box.

towner_names.explanation:
towner_names maps from towner IDs to NPC names.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#towner_id

log_not_created.explanation: log_not_created specifies whether the log file has not yet been created.

log_file.explanation: log_file is a handle to the log file.

str_4A0E74.explanation: "Unable to write to save file archive"

spelicon_frame_from_spell_id.explanation: spelicon_frame_from_spell_id maps from spell_id to spelicon.cel frame number.

panel_buttons.explanation:
panel_buttons maps from panel_button_id to the position and dimensions of a
panel button.

button_hotkeys.explanation: button_hotkeys maps from panel_button_id to hotkey name.

button_descriptions.explanation: button_descriptions maps from panel_button_id to panel button description.

attribute_inc_rects.explanation:
attribute_inc_rects maps from attribute_id to the rectangle on screen used
for attribute increment buttons.

spell_id_from_spellbook_pos.explanation: spell_id_from_spellbook_pos maps from spellbook position to spell_id.

error_messages.explanation: error_messages maps from error_id to error message.

tile_draw_masks.explanation:
tile_draw_masks specifies the draw masks used to render transparency of
tiles.

setmap_rects.explanation: setmap_rects specifies areas used for set maps.

quest_level_names.explanation:
quest_level_names maps from quest level to quest level names.
References:
   * https://github.com/sanctuary/notes/blob/master/enums.h#quest_level

towner_anim_seq.explanation: towner_anim_seq specifies the animation frame sequence of a given NPC.

cow_start_x.explanation: cow_start_x specifies the start X-coordinates of the cows in Tristram.

cow_start_y.explanation: cow_start_y specifies the start Y-coordinates of the cows in Tristram.

cow_start_direction.explanation: cow_start_direction specifies the start directions of the cows in Tristram.

cow_x_delta_from_direction.explanation:
cow_x_delta_from_direction maps from direction to X-coordinate delta, which
is used when placing cows in Tristram. A single cow may require space of up
to three tiles when being placed on the map.

cow_y_delta_from_direction.explanation:
cow_y_delta_from_direction maps from direction to Y-coordinate delta, which
is used when placing cows in Tristram. A single cow may require space of up
to three tiles when being placed on the map.

gossip_data.explanation: gossip_data contains the data related to quest gossip for each towner ID.

cow_active_sfx_id.explanation:
cow_active_sfx_id specifies the active sound effect ID for interacting with
cows.

str_48E44C.explanation: "Press ESC to end or the arrow keys to scroll."

sfx_data.explanation: sfx_data contains the data related to each sound effect ID.

monster_modes.explanation: monster_modes maps from monster mode to monster mode name.

player_modes.explanation: player_modes maps from player mode to player mode name.

l1_tile_id_pattern_lookup.explanation:
l1_tile_id_pattern_lookup is a lookup table for the 16 possible patterns of a
2x2 area, where each cell either contains a SW door or it doesn't.

special_theme_ids.explanation:
special_theme_ids specifies the set of special theme IDs from which one will
be selected at random.

x_delta_5x5.explanation: x_delta_5x5 specifies a 5x5 area to fit theme objects.

y_delta_5x5.explanation: y_delta_5x5 specifies a 5x5 area to fit theme objects.

x_delta_3x3.explanation: x_delta_3x3 specifies a 3x3 area to fit theme objects.

y_delta_3x3.explanation: y_delta_3x3 specifies a 3x3 area to fit theme objects.

menu_music_track_id.explanation: menu_music_track_id specifies the active music track id for the main menu.

hArchive.explanation: hArchive is a handle to the opened MPQ archive.
